New Records: Argentina won a record 16th Copa América title
Key Match Events: Lautaro Martínez scored the winning goal in the 112th minute
Lionel Messi suffered a noncontact injury and left the game in the 64th minute
Pre-Game Insights: The match was delayed from 8 p.m. ET to 9:22 p.m. due to crowd control issues
The grass was heavily watered with sprinklers following the half-time performance by Colombian pop star Shakira
Post-Match Reflections: Angel Di Maria announced his retirement from international football after the Copa
Nicolas Otamendi is also set to end his international career
Miscellaneous Highlights: The win marked Argentina's third straight major title following the 2021 Copa América and 2022 World Cup
Argentina matched Spain's record of winning three major titles in a row
